description: This file implements a FocusManager class in TypeScript that manages focusable elements within a web application. It organizes elements into groups, tracks the last focused element per group, allows navigation between elements and groups, and persists focus state using sessionStorage.

classes.name: FocusManager
classes.description: A class that manages focusable elements organized by groups, providing methods to register elements, move focus, and persist focus state.

methods.name: register
methods.description: Registers a focusable element into a specified group, maintaining order and last focused index.

methods.name: focus
methods.description: Focuses a specific element within a group, optionally by index.

methods.name: focusNext
methods.description: Moves focus to the next element in the specified group, with wrap-around.

methods.name: focusPrev
methods.description: Moves focus to the previous element in the specified group, with wrap-around.

methods.name: getCurrent
methods.description: Returns the current focused group and index.

methods.name: focusFirstInNextGroup
methods.description: Focuses the first element in the next group in the predefined order.

methods.name: focusFirstInPrevGroup
methods.description: Focuses the first element in the previous group in the predefined order.

methods.name: setCurrent
methods.description: Explicitly sets the current focus context to a specific group and index.
